pullRequest.title: [C#][netcore] auto-generate appveyor.yml
pullRequest.bodyText:
auto-generate appveyor.yml
tested in https://github.com/wing328/petstore-csharp


PR checklist

 Read the contribution guidelines.
 Pull Request title clearly describes the work in the pull request and Pull Request description provides details about how to validate the work. Missing information here may result in delayed response from the community.
 If contributing template-only or documentation-only changes which will change sample output, build the project beforehand.
 Run the shell script ./bin/generate-samples.shto update all Petstore samples related to your fix. This is important, as CI jobs will verify all generator outputs of your HEAD commit as it would merge with master. These must match the expectations made by your contribution. You may regenerate an individual generator by passing the relevant config(s) as an argument to the script, for example ./bin/generate-samples.sh bin/configs/java*. For Windows users, please run the script in Git BASH.
 File the PR against the correct branch: master
 Copy the technical committee to review the pull request if your PR is targeting a particular programming language.

cc @mandrean (2017/08) @frankyjuang (2019/09) @shibayan (2020/02)

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            before_build:
          
          
            
            - dotnet restore
          
      
    
    
  

If you use the dotnet build command, dotnet restore is automatic and is not needed.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@
+# auto-generated by OpenAPI Generator (https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator)
+#
+image: Visual Studio 2019
+clone_depth: 1
+before_build:
+- dotnet restore

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            build:
          
          
            
              project: {{{packageName}}}.sln
          
          
            
              verbosity: minimal
          
          
            
            build_script:
          
          
            
            - dotnet build -c Release
          
      
    
    
  

Since the appveyor build command behaves differently on Windows and Linux, it is better to use the dotnet build command.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@
+# auto-generated by OpenAPI Generator (https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator)
+#
+image: Visual Studio 2019
+clone_depth: 1
+before_build:
+- dotnet restore
+build:
+  project: {{{packageName}}}.sln
+  verbosity: minimal

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            test_script:
          
          
            
            - dotnet test -c Release .\src\{{{packageName}}}.Test\{{{packageName}}}.Test.csproj
          
          
            
            - dotnet test -c Release
          
      
    
    
  

dotnet test automatically searches for test projects included in the solution, so there is no need to explicitly specify projects.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@
+# auto-generated by OpenAPI Generator (https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator)
+#
+image: Visual Studio 2019
+clone_depth: 1
+before_build:
+- dotnet restore
+build:
+  project: {{{packageName}}}.sln
+  verbosity: minimal
+test_script:
+- dotnet test -c Release .\src\{{{packageName}}}.Test\{{{packageName}}}.Test.csproj

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            - dotnet pack .\src\{{{packageName}}}\{{{packageName}}}.csproj -o ../../output --no-build
          
          
            
            - dotnet pack .\src\{{{packageName}}}\{{{packageName}}}.csproj -o ../../output -c Release --no-build
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@
+# auto-generated by OpenAPI Generator (https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator)
+#
+image: Visual Studio 2019
+clone_depth: 1
+before_build:
+- dotnet restore
+build:
+  project: {{{packageName}}}.sln
+  verbosity: minimal
+test_script:
+- dotnet test -c Release .\src\{{{packageName}}}.Test\{{{packageName}}}.Test.csproj
+after_build:
+- dotnet pack .\src\{{{packageName}}}\{{{packageName}}}.csproj -o ../../output --no-build
